title: cata-list
description: Lists of some of the best information, media, tools, and wisdom which can help to inform, empower, and act as catalysts for positive change in this perilous yet promising time.
copyright: Copyright © 2020 Matthew McCutcheon. All rights reserved

articles.title: Kayfabe
articles.description: In professional wrestling, kayfabe (also called work or worked) is the portrayal of staged events within the industry as 'real' or 'true',  specifically the portrayal of competition, rivalries, and relationships between participants as being genuine and not of a staged or predetermined nature of any kind. The term kayfabe has evolved to also become a code word of sorts for maintaining this 'reality' within the direct or indirect presence of the general public.

articles.title: 2020 Chernobyl Exclusion Zone Wildfires
articles.description: The 2020 Chernobyl Exclusion Zone wildfires were a series of wildfires that began burning inside Ukraine's Chernobyl Exclusion Zone in April 2020. The fires were largely extinguished within two weeks, at least one suspect was arrested for alleged arson.

articles.title: Another Disaster Is Ready to Catch the US Unprepared: Drought
articles.description: Like COVID-19, water insecurity is set to hit the most vulnerable the hardest.

articles.title: EPA Says Incidental Benefits of Pollution Rules Don't Count
articles.description: Cutting mercury emissions removes soot, too, but the EPA won't consider that.

articles.title: Sci-Fi Fanatics Suspected of Arson as Wildfires Near Chernobyl Create World's Worst Air Pollution
articles.description: Wildfires are burning yet again in the area outside the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine. The latest round of blazes has sent smoke traveling to the capital of Kyiv, creating some of the worst air pollution in the world.

articles.title: As Africa Drowns in Garbage, the Plastics Business Keeps Booming
articles.description: In a Kenyan dump overflowing with plastic waste, waste-pickers risk disease and injury to collect precious scraps for redemption.

articles.title: Areas With More Air Pollution Have Had More Covid-19 Fatalities
articles.description: New research shows that exposure to air pollution may be 'one of the most important contributors to fatality' caused by covid-19.

articles.title: Offshore Drilling Has Dug Itself a Deeper Hole Since Deepwater Horizon
articles.description: There are new worst-case scenarios that the industry still isn't prepared for.

articles.title: Oil Plunges Below Zero for First Time in Unprecedented Wipeout
articles.description: Of all the wild, unprecedented swings in financial markets since the coronavirus pandemic broke out, none has been more jaw-dropping than Monday’s collapse in a key segment of U.S. oil trading.

articles.title: 'Horrible Hybrids': The Plastic Products That Give Recyclers Nightmares
articles.description: From singing birthday cards to baby food pouches, a growing trend of mixing materials is making recycling even harder

articles.title: The Coal Industry's a New 'Clean Coal' Scheme Is Dirty
articles.description: In the summer of 2017, Mary Hess, a retired postal worker, heard rumors about a proposal for a mysterious new coal plant to be built in her town of Dale, Indiana. But for months, they were just rumors, because it was hard to find any details about the project.

articles.title: New MIT Machine Learning Model Shows Relaxing Quarantine Rules Will Spike COVID-19 Cases – TechCrunch
articles.description: MIT has developed a new model of the spread of COVID-19 infection, based on publicly available data, combined with established epidemiological equations about outbreaks, and neural network-based inference. The model, described in a new report, proves accurate when trained on data spanning late Janu…

articles.title: U.S. Judge Blocks Twitter's Bid to Reveal Government Surveillance Requests
articles.description: Twitter Inc will not be able to reveal surveillance requests it received from the U.S. government after a federal judge accepted government arguments that this was likely to harm national security after a near six-year long legal battle.

articles.title: Carnival Executives Knew They Had a Virus Problem, But Kept the Party Going
articles.description: More than 1,500 people on the company’s cruise ships have been diagnosed with Covid-19, and dozens have died.

articles.title: 'We Needed to Go': Rich Americans Activate Pandemic Escape Plans
articles.description: Interest in New Zealand bunkers has surged.

articles.title: CDC's Failed Coronavirus Tests Were Tainted With Coronavirus, Feds Confirm
articles.description: A federal investigation found CDC researchers not following protocol.

articles.title: 'Church' Claims Bleach Is Coronavirus-Curing 'Sacrament,' Faces Wrath of FDA
articles.description: Injunction forces 'non-religious church' to stop selling bleach as miracle drug.

articles.title: Buildings Have Their Own Microbiomes – We're Striving to Make Them Healthy Places
articles.description: We spend 90% of our lives indoors, and every building has its own indoor microbiome. Can we learn to manage them in ways that support helpful microbes and suppress harmful ones?

articles.title: Coronavirus: Why We Should Be Sceptical About the Benevolence of Billionaires
articles.description: Generosity is good, but philanthropy can come at a significant social cost.

articles.title: 267 Million Facebook Profiles Sold for $600 on the Dark Web
articles.description: Threat actors are selling over 267 million Facebook profiles for £500 ($623) on dark web sites and hacker forums. While none of these records include passwords, they do contain information that could allow attackers to perform spear phishing or SMS attacks to steal credentials.

articles.title: Over 500,000 Zoom Accounts Sold on Hacker Forums, the Dark Web
articles.description: Over 500,000 Zoom accounts are being sold on the dark web and hacker forums for less than a penny each, and in some cases, given away for free.

articles.title: Who Ordered the Car Bomb That Killed Maltese Journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia?
articles.description: The reporter was killed last October, as she was digging up dirt on Malta's most powerful. The final words on her blog were: 'There are crooks everywhere you look now. The situation is desperate.'

articles.title: Waco Siege
articles.description: The Waco siege was the siege of a compound belonging to the religious sect Branch Davidians, carried out by American federal and Texas state law enforcement, as well as the U.S. military, between February 28 and April 19, 1993. The incident began when the ATF attempted to raid the ranch. An intense gun battle erupted, resulting in the deaths of four government agents and six Branch Davidians. Upon the ATF's failure to raid the compound, a siege lasting 51 days was initiated by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). Eventually, the FBI launched an assault and initiated a tear gas attack in an attempt to force the Branch Davidians out of the ranch. During the attack, a fire engulfed Mount Carmel Center. This resulted in the deaths of 76 Branch Davidians, including 25 children, two pregnant women and David Koresh.

articles.title: Crimson Contagion
articles.description: Crimson Contagion was a simulation administered by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services from January to August 2019 that tested the capacity of the U.S. federal government and twelve U.S. states to respond to a severe influenza pandemic originating in China. The exercise involves a scenario in which tourists returning from China spread a respiratory virus in the United States, beginning in Chicago. In less than two months the virus had infected 110 million Americans, killing more than half a million. The report issued at the conclusion of the exercise outlines the government's limited capacity to respond to a pandemic, with federal agencies lacking the funds, coordination, and resources to facilitate an effective response to the virus.

quotes.author: Bertrand Russell
quotes.quote: One of the painful things about our time is that those who feel certainty are stupid, and those with any imagination and understanding are filled with doubt and indecision.
